greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominator of product{k=1 to n} k^mu(k), where mu is the Moebius function A008683.
comment: a(n) is also the denominator of H(n)^2 * n! for all n < 897, where H(n) = 1 + 1/2 + ... + 1/n is the n-th harmonic number. - _John M. Campbell_, May 13 2011
link: Ivan Neretin and Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4642 (first 1000 terms from Ivan Neretin)
mathematica: With[{s = Array[#^MoebiusMu@ # &, 39]}, Denominator@ Table[Times @@ Take[s, n], {n, Length@ s}]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 20 2017 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, May 06 2007
